Description: Sandstone foundation deposit of Tausret: sandstone brick deeply carved on one side with the prenomen and nomen of Tausret. There is slight chipping on the edges. There are no traces of colour.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. A. Wallis Budge 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (London, 1922), 136 (no. 7); 'Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne' [exhibition catalogue] (Saint-Gérard, 1997), p.114 [50].
Bibliographic references: Bierbrier 1993 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 12. (Pl.14-15)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1992 Jul-Oct, Norfolk, Swaffham Museum, Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
